intro: Bauhinia bidentata var. bicornuta, commonly known as the two-toothed bauhinia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, bipinnate leaves. The plant produces showy, butterfly-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and blooms. The seeds are enclosed in flat, pod-like fruits that split open when mature.
